responses: When you feel anxious, try this grounding technique: Look around and identify 5 things you can see, 4 you can touch, 3 you can hear, 2 you can smell, and 1 you can taste.
Deep breathing can help calm your nerves. Try breathing in for 4 counts, holding for 4, and exhaling slowly. Repeat several times.
Try a progressive muscle relaxation exercise: Start by tensing each muscle group, then slowly release them, starting from your toes and working up to your head.
Anxiety can feel overwhelming, but try taking a few minutes to focus on your breath. Breathe in slowly for a count of 4, hold for 4, and exhale for 4.
Take a moment to check in with yourself: What's going on around you? Practice mindfulness to bring yourself back to the present moment.
